enGB: When you use your animal focus class feature, you can choose any of the following new aspects: Air, Chaotic, Cold, Earth, Evil, Fire, Good, Lawful, Shadow, Water.
You gain immunity to difficult terrain and ground based effects.

Your form shifts subtly, making it difficult for others to aim precise attacks against you. You gain a 25% chance to negate extra damage from critical hits and precision damage from attacks made against you (such as from sneak attacks).
Creatures that attack you with natural attacks or melee weapons take 1d4 points of cold damage for every 4 class levels you possess.
You gain +2 bonus to CMB when performing bull rush maneuver, and a +2 bonus to CMD when defending against it. You also receive +2 enhancement bonus to your natural armor.
You gain a +2 profane bonus to AC and on saves against attacks made and effects created by good outsiders.
Your natural attacks and melee weapons deal 1d6 points of fire damage for every 4 class levels you possess.
You gain a +2 sacred bonus to AC and on saves against attacks made or effects created by evil outsiders.
You gain immunity to polymorph spells.
You gain a +5 bonus on Stealth and Trickery checks.
You gain immunity to combat maneuvers.

Choose one animal focus. When you apply that animal focus to your animal companion, the benefits increase by one step. For example, if you are 6th level and choose the bear animal focus, then when you apply the animal focus to your animal companion, it gains a +4 inherent bonus to Constitution instead of +2.
The animal companions Strength bonus increases by one step when using Animal Focus - Bull up to +8.
The animal companions Constitution bonus increases by one step when using Animal Focus - Bear up to +8.
The animal companions Dexterity bonus increases to by one step when using Animal Focus - Tiger up to +8
The animal companions movement speed bonus increases by one step when using Animal Focus - Stag up to +30.
The animal companions Perception bonus increases by one step when using Animal Focus - Falcon up to +12.
The animal companions gains Improved Uncanny Dodge when using Animal Focus - Mouse using its level as rogue levels for the purpose of determining flanking.
The animal companions stealth bonus increases by one step when using Animal Focus - Owl up to +12.
The animal companions athletics bonus increases by one step when using Animal Focus - Monkey up to +12.
Once per round when this animal companion hits an opponent with a charge attack, it can initiate a bull rush against that target as a free action.

If the animal companion pushes the target at least 10 feet as a result of Forceful Charge, it can attempt a trip combat maneuver check against the target as a free action. This trip combat maneuver provokes attacks of opportunity as normal.
The creatures natural armor bonus increases by +1. A creature can gain this feat multiple times. Each time the creature takes the feat, its natural armor bonus increases by another point.

Choose one of the creatures natural attack forms (not an unarmed strike). The damage for this natural attack increases by one step on the following list, as if the creatures size had increased by one category. Damage dice increase as follows: 1d2, 1d3, 1d4, 1d6, 1d8, 2d6, 3d6, 4d6, 6d6, 8d6, 12d6. This feat can be taken multiple times for a different natural attack.

Select a 1-point evolution other than pounce or reach from those available to a summoners eidolon. Your animal companion gains this evolution. The animal companion must conform to any limitations of the evolution. You may take this feat multiple times for a unique evolution.

One of the eidolons natural attacks is particularly deadly. Select one natural attack form and increase the damage die type by one step. This evolution can be selected more than once. Its effects do not stack. Each time an eidolon selects this evolution, it applies to a different natural attack.
An eidolon has a pair of vicious claws at the end of its limbs, giving it two claw attacks. These attacks are primary attacks. The claws deal 1d4 points of damage (1d6 if Large, 1d8 if Huge).

Select one animal aspect from the list presented in the hunter classs animal focus class feature. Your animal companion gains the benefits of the selected animal aspect, treating its Hit Dice as its effective hunter level for this ability.
The creature gains a +2 inherent bonus to Strength. This bonus increases to +4 at 8th level and +6 at 15th level.
The creature gains a +2 inherent bonus to Constitution. This bonus increases to +4 at 8th level and +6 at 15th level.
The creature gains a +2 inherent bonus to Dexterity. This bonus increases to +4 at 8th level and +6 at 15th level.
The creature gains a +4 inherent bonus to Perception. This bonus increases to +6 at 8th level and +8 at 15th level.
The creature gains a +4 inherent bonus to Athletics. This bonus increases to +6 at 8th level and +8 at 15th level.
The creature gains a +5 inherent bonus to Movement Speed. This bonus increases to +10 at 8th level and +20 at 15th level.
The creature gains a +4 inherent bonus to Stealth. This bonus increases to +6 at 8th level and +8 at 15th level.
The creature gains evasion, as the rogue class feature. At 12th level, this increases to improved evasion, as the rogue advanced talent.
The creature becomes especially adept at a specific skill, gaining a +8 racial bonus on that skill. This evolution can be selected more than once. Its effects do not stack.
The creatures hide grows thick fur, rigid scales, or bony plates, giving it a +2 bonus to its natural armor. This evolution can be taken once for every five levels the character possesses.
Your animal companion or familiars type changes to Ågundead.Åh The creature gains fast healing 5 as well as your vampire or dhampir weaknesses.

At the start of the day, you can choose to commune with a single shaman spirit. Once during the next 24 hours, you can spend a standard action to grant your animal companion or familiar that shaman spirits spirit animal ability for 1 minute per level in the class that grants your animal companion or familiar.

The shamans spirit animal looks like a fiercer version of its species, with rippling muscles and a stockier frame. It gains a +2 natural armor bonus to AC. If it already has a natural armor bonus, the bonus increases by 2 instead.
The shamans spirit animal gives off a ghostly glow and seems nearly transparent. The animal is under the constant effects of blur, with a caster level equal to the shamans level.

The shamans spirit animal is surrounded by a nimbus of flame that gives off light like a candle. This nimbus is warm to the touch, but doesnt cause any damage. The animal is immune to fire damage, but is vulnerable to cold damage.
The shamans spirit animal is covered in a light layer of glimmering frost, and its breath comes out as mist regardless of the temperature. The animal has resistance 5 to cold and electricity.

The shamans spirit animal appears to be a beautiful and very healthy version of its species, and seems especially vibrant and full of life. Her animal companion gains fast healing 1; if the spirit animal already has fast healing, instead its fast healing increases by 1.
The shamans spirit animal appears to be quiet and unassuming. It gains a +2 bonus on Initiative checks and a +4 bonus on Stealth checks.
The shamans spirit animal appears more primal and prehistoric than an ordinary animal of its kind. It gains a +2 inherent bonus to its Strength score.

The shamans spirit animal looks feral, and appears to be in peak physical form. The animal can move through any sort of undergrowth or natural difficult terrain at its normal speed without taking damage or suffering any other impairment.
The shamans spirit animal looks like a leaner version of its species, with hungry eyes and a wiry frame. It gains a +4 bonus on initiative checks.
The shamans spirit animal looks as though its made out of earth and stone, with tiny gemstones embedded in its flesh. The animal gains DR 5/adamantine.
The skin of the shamans spirit animal constantly distorts, much as a ponds surface ripples when drops of water fall gently into it. The animal gains Mobility as a bonus feat.

The shamans spirit animal crackles with electrical energy when it moves, giving off light like a candle. This electricity deals no damage to the animal or any creature that touches the animal. The animal gains electricity resistance 10.

When you have this ability toggled and that companion creature has this feat, you can cast a spell on yourself and divide the duration evenly between yourself and the companion creature. You can use this feat only on spells with a duration of at least 2 rounds. For example, you could cast bulls strength on yourself, and instead of the spell lasting 1 minute per level on yourself, it lasts 5 rounds per level on yourself and 5 rounds per level on your companion.
